> 
> Can you help me please? I'm having this issue:
> If I try to control my servo, it doesn't work and this happens.
> 
> [http://i.hizliresim.com/JYYlnn.jpg](http://i.hizliresim.com/JYYlnn.jpg)

So engine is not attached to the hinge or what? Can you try replace legacy hinge with Pivotron from Zodius's pack [\[WIP\] MSI's Infernal Robotics - Model Rework (Updated: 28/04/2015)](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/65365-WIP-MSI-s-Infernal-Robotics-Model-Rework-%28Updated-28-04-2015%29) ?

> 
> Please try cleaning ATM cache.

If you're using CKAN please wait until we push the hotfix release (0.21.1) there as well or just download it manually.

I'm not sure how long this has been a thing, but I love that IR now has it's own Robotic Parts category in the VAB/SPH. I was wondering how to do that with other mods/parts. It doesn't seem to be cfg related, because all the IR parts have the Utility category set there. Speaking of which, is there a reason to have duplicates in the Utility, now that there is Robotics Parts?

Anyway, back to my question, how does one create own category like that? Also, how to add parts to it, because "category = Robotic Parts" didn't work (I'm no modder, all I can do is mess around with cfgs). I know I can use stuff like Filter Extensions, but I'm curious how this has been done. Even a link would be appreciated.

> 
> If you're using CKAN please wait until we push the hotfix release (0.21.1) there as well or just download it manually.

 I see thanks, didn't realize CKAN version wasn't up to date.

> 
> It's happening again

Zodius is working on this issue.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> I'm not sure how long this has been a thing, but I love that IR now has it's own Robotic Parts category in the VAB/SPH. I was wondering how to do that with other mods/parts. It doesn't seem to be cfg related, because all the IR parts have the Utility category set there. Speaking of which, is there a reason to have duplicates in the Utility, now that there is Robotics Parts?
> Anyway, back to my question, how does one create own category like that? Also, how to add parts to it, because "category = Robotic Parts" didn't work (I'm no modder, all I can do is mess around with cfgs). I know I can use stuff like Filter Extensions, but I'm curious how this has been done. Even a link would be appreciated.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/106656-Editor-Toolbar-Modding-Guide](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/106656-Editor-Toolbar-Modding-Guide)

> 
> Zodius is working on this issue.

Only for the Model Rework parts. Someone else will need to address the problem with the Legacy parts.

> 
> I just added
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>     .*/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/.*    {        compress = false        mipmaps = false        scale = 1        max_size = 0        compress_normals = false        mipmaps_normals = false        make_not_readable = false    }
> 
> 
> 
> 
> to my ATM config under OVERRIDES, cleared the cache, and it seems to have worked for me.

Thank you! Could you also post this in ATM thread so it can be included into future releases?
AVC is telling me that IR .21.1 is for ksp .90...

> 
> AVC is telling me that IR .21.1 is for ksp .90...

From which site? Curse? Kerbal Stuff?

AVC is telling me IR .21.1 is for KSP 23.5 

from Curse

> 
> AVC is telling me IR .21.1 is for KSP 23.5 
> from Curse

Our .version file is slightly wrong. We'll fix that soon, it should not affect anything game-wise.

> 
> Our .version file is slightly wrong. We'll fix that soon, it should not affect anything game-wise.

thanks!

Updated the .version file. NOTE: kerbalstuff got weird on me so i had to append an "a" at the end of the version number. There isn't a 0.21.1 a, it just wouldnt let me upload the correct value. \*sigh\*

Hi

I just want to report back that the parts who are normaly white in the VAB are now black and they have sort of a black tint.... 

Please fix this :-)

> 
> Hi
> I just want to report back that the parts who are normaly white in the VAB are now black and they have sort of a black tint.... 
> 
> Please fix this :-)

Are you using Active Texture Management by any chance? That seems to be breaking the textures of a number of mods now.
It's nice to see you are doing well)

> 
> Are you using Active Texture Management by any chance? That seems to be breaking the textures of a number of mods now.

Same here and yes i do. 

Thank you for info

Ok im having a problem here i am not seeing any of the new parts

- - - Updated - - -

My fault i thought the model rework had been combined into the main pack now. Sorted it.

Not sure if this is a bug or not, but I noticed when trying to set a rotation limit, the slider jumps by four "points" each time, making it impossible to set proper limitations (i.e., cannot set the slider to 0).

To make the textures not black, ever, go to MagicSmokeIndustries.cfg under GameData\ActiveTextureManagement\ActiveTextureManagerConfigs and change **enabled** to **false**, then delete the MagicSmokeIndustries folder in the GameData\ActiveTextureManagement\textureCache folder.

EDIT: or not? :/

I'm using IR as installed by CKAN, and IR is totally taking over my toolbar. Every time I load a vessel, I get a new IR button. When I quit last time I had like 10 of them. In the magicsmoke industries folder, the version file says 0.12 for ksp version 0.23.5... while CKAN seems to think it's version 0.21 for ksp version 1.0.0. Did I do something wrong?

EDIT: okay, I see changelog says latest version fixes a bug with the toolbar... so I guess CKAN is just out of date. I really wanna use CKAN, but I may have to do without.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-01T05:12:18Z" title="05/01/2015 05:12  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 1, 2015</time> by impyre**
Can you try again? We've revently pushed updates everywhere.
